design_audit.strata_or_blocks: district x gender x grade (district_gender_*, gender_grade_*)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Gender attitude index (standardized, endline 1; E_Sgender_index2), an inverse-covariance-weighted index of survey items on gender norms
claim_object.treatment_concept: School-level Breakthrough gender-equality curriculum (3-year intervention, grades 6-9)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of the Breakthrough curriculum on gender attitudes (combined across boys and girls)
claim_object.target_population: Students in government schools in Haryana, India (grades 6-7 at baseline, both genders)

baseline_specs.label: Table1.2-Combined-GenderAttitudes
baseline_specs.controls_description: Baseline gender attitude index + district-by-gender strata FE (8 dummies) + gender-by-grade strata FE (4 dummies) + endline component missing flags (~17 flags from ${el_gender_flag})
baseline_specs.n_controls_note: 13 listed controls + ~17 endline component missing flags (${el_gender_flag}). The code includes these flags in the regression even though they are not listed in the controls vector. Actual n_controls depends on how many flag variables resolve to non-collinear in sample.

constraints.notes: Minimum: difference-in-means (no controls). Maximum: LASSO-selected extended controls (cntrls_all_8 set, ~50 vars including demographics, school characteristics, census variables, strata FE, missing flags). The paper reveals a large control range: from simple strata FE (Table 1.2) to LASSO-selected extended controls (Appendix Table 1.10).

canonical.notes: Matches the paper's baseline: cluster at the school level (unit of randomization).

variants.notes: Coarser clustering at district level (only 4 districts -- will produce unreliable inference, included as extreme stress test).

sampling.notes: Full enumeration of planned specs (under 50 total). No random sampling needed.

design_audit.strata_or_blocks: district x gender x grade (district_gender_*, gender_grade_*)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Self-reported behavior index (standardized, endline 1; E_Sbehavior_index2), an inverse-covariance-weighted index of gender-related behaviors
claim_object.treatment_concept: School-level Breakthrough gender-equality curriculum (3-year intervention, grades 6-9)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of the Breakthrough curriculum on gender-related behaviors (combined across boys and girls)
claim_object.target_population: Students in government schools in Haryana, India (grades 6-7 at baseline, both genders)

baseline_specs.label: Table1.2-Combined-Behavior
baseline_specs.controls_description: Baseline behavior index + district-by-gender strata FE (8 dummies) + gender-by-grade strata FE (4 dummies) + endline component missing flags (~6 flags from ${el_behavior_common_flag})
baseline_specs.n_controls_note: 13 listed controls + ~6 endline behavior component missing flags (${el_behavior_common_flag}). Actual n_controls depends on non-collinear flags in sample.

constraints.notes: Same control set structure as G1. Baseline behavior index replaces baseline gender index.

canonical.notes: Matches the paper's baseline: cluster at the school level (unit of randomization).

sampling.notes: Full enumeration. No random sampling needed.
